name: inaSpeechSegmenter Wrapper
description: inaSpeechSegmenter is a CNN-based audio segmentation toolkit. The original software can be found at https://github.com/ina-foss/inaSpeechSegmenter .

output.description: The INA semgmenter uses 5-way classification (['noEnergy', 'female', 'male', 'noise', 'music']) and this wrapper remaps the labels to ['silence', 'speech', 'noise', 'music'], by 1) renaming `noEnergy` to `silence` 2) collapsing `female` and `male` into `speech` (leaving additional `gender` property). Note that the time frame annotations do not exhaustively cover the input audio, but only the segments.

parameters.name: minTFDuration
parameters.description: minimum duration of a TimeFrame in milliseconds

parameters.name: silenceRatio
parameters.description: percentage ratio (0-100) of audio energy to to determine silence, ratio to mean every of the input audio.

parameters.name: pretty
parameters.description: The JSON body of the HTTP response will be re-formatted with 2-space indentation

parameters.name: runningTime
parameters.description: The running time of the app will be recorded in the view metadata

parameters.name: hwFetch
parameters.description: The hardware information (architecture, GPU and vRAM) will be recorded in the view metadata
